Trial_Design.evidence: A single-center, prospective, single-arm pilot trial was conducted

Participants.evidence: The study population included 12 subjects over 18 years old who were admitted to the surgical ICU after open abdominal surgery.

Intervention.evidence: A low-dose lidocaine infusion of 10–30 mcg/kg/min within 1 h of ICU admission.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the feasibility of conducting a subsequent full-scale, randomized controlled trial (RCT) on the use of systemic lidocaine infusion in surgical intensive care units (ICUs).

Number_Analysed.evidence: All 12 remaining participants were included in the analysis at the baseline stage.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The pain scores decreased by 1.09 units per day (β = −1.09; 95% CI: −1.82 to −0.36; p = 0.003)

Harms.evidence: The safety outcomes included adverse events and serum lidocaine levels, with no serious adverse events reported.
